channel.title: Hacking school's complicated system?
channel.description:
Our school is so protective over what we look and see on the web and on the computers, they have limited so much on the computers!
They block every website thats not on the schools "safe" list of websites! Except a few websites that have been linked from a safe website...
All the computers are windows 98 except a few, The comps are around 6 years old and only Pentium 3s...
Also, every time someone is to "shutdown" the computer it erases everything on the harddrive and resets the comp back to the way before it was touched!
Bois is pass encrypted!
I can access logmein but the schools comp never connects to the server or computer i want to log onto!
Also if i start using a site often they will look at my activity and block the site!
The school is set up with Novel...
Any ideas on hacking the schools comps?
PS: "Run" Is blocked and i can't run batch files~!

item.title: Hacking school's complicated system?
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

[quote=“lawl, post:1, topic:187589”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=249993.msg2097216#msg2097216 date=1205042069]
Set up a home server with ssh. Download putty onto the computer at school and use it to connect to your home machine. Use the server at home (from school) to connect to websites. It will be slower this way but will work.

(and if they block the ssh port, just use a different one like 8080)
[/quote]
how is he supposed to use putty if he

  1. cant go to websites that arent whitelisted
  2. cant run executables[/quote]
    Yeah, but he can still use…

TEH JAGREX SYNTACKZ SERVRZ!!!1111

Read full topic

item.title: Hacking school's complicated system?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Set up a home server with ssh. Download putty onto the computer at school and use it to connect to your home machine. Use the server at home (from school) to connect to websites. It will be slower this way but will work.

(and if they block the ssh port, just use a different one like 8080)

item.title: Hacking school's complicated system?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“bootnecklad, post:14, topic:187387”]Ever known about installing a new OS?
Your gonna need:
Boot floppy with MS-DOS
win 98 CD + key
Ubuntu linux 6.06 should work pretty well.
slap the floppy and 98 disk in format drive, partition, install 98, install linux on partition and tada!!!
Set things up as needed…[/quote]
He said that BOIS was Password Encrypted and i think it means BIOS, and then there is a very little chance that you can’t boot from CD.

Read full topic

item.title: Hacking school's complicated system?
item.dc:creator: @pwnm30rdi3 pwnm30rdi3
item.description:
@pwnm30rdi3 wrote:

[quote=“ThugLife, post:8, topic:187387”]Yes i came home once to find my computer missing, my dad rang my up and said that he deleted my computer once i gave him my ip.

Stop being so gullible, how the hell is anyone supposed to “delete” an object with just a number. It is not physically possible.[/quote]

Can’t you hack through open ports though?
